chapter.title: Distribution Setup
chapter.para: This document describes ways to setup an entire distribution, including release management, update stack and service pack generation support.

section.title: General Project setup for a maintained distribution
Contribute directly to foreign projects
section.para: In case a user does not have commit permissions to a project, he can request to get maintainership permissions to this project. This makes sense if the user is already known to the project owners and they trust him as a maintainer. There is a way to do this via the request system of OBS, but only via osc so far: # osc createrequest -a add_me maintainer PROJECT

section.title: Contribute indirect to foreign projects
section.para: Users who are new to a certain project, either because they are new users at all or don't have any deeper knowledge about this certain project don't have direct commit permissions. However, they can still create a copy of any package source and ask back to merge their changes. &obs; has support to make this easy.
